hackathon-description-text: The purpose of the hackathon is to give developers, designers, and entrepreneurs the chance to pitch app ideas - form teams - build a prototype of their mobile app - and present to our hackathon judges for a chance to be one of the top 3 hackathon winners who get publicity and connections during MobileWeek.
hackathon-eligibility: Anyone attending the MobileWeek 2014 hackathon is eligible to participate
hackathon-rules:
In order for your team's project to be eligible for sponsor prizes, you must satisfy the following criteria
Your team project will be judged on (3) criteria.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Jambox and also $50 gift cards for additional team members.
2 Top teams implementing Twitter API or MoPub API each get (2) tote bags w/ Arduino board, t shirts, water bottles, moleskin, screen wipes. Get more info at dev.twitter.com
A Patagonia backpack stuffed with great Millennial Media swag,  a $500 advertising credit from mMedia and a Nexus 7 tablet.
6 months of Spotify Premium, A Pair AiAiAi Spotify Branded Headphones,

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=45 West 18th Street, New York, NY 10011, USA
hackathon-location-address: 45 West 18th Street, New York, NY 10011, USA
hackathon-description-header: The MobileWeek Hackathon is a 30-hour app-building contest in downtown New York City - and is also the official kick-off of MobileWeek 2014!
